name: Pesto Pasta Salad
steps: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain and rinse with cold water.
In a large bowl, whisk together pesto, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Add cooked pasta, cherry tomatoes, Kalamata olives, and feta cheese to the bowl and toss to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
author: Sara Lee

name: Classic Pancakes
steps: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick griddle over medium-high heat. Pour 1/4 cup batter onto the griddle for each pancake.
Cook until the edges are dry and bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another minute or until cooked through.
author: John Doe

name: Easy Baked Chicken Breasts
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with foil and lightly grease with cooking spray.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, garlic powder, onion powder, dried basil, dried oregano, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Place the chicken breasts on the prepared baking sheet and brush both sides with the seasoned oil.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.
author: Bob Johnson

name: Mediterranean Stuffed Peppers
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Line a baking dish with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, stir together quinoa, feta cheese, Kalamata olives, parsley, oregano, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Fill each bell pepper half with the quinoa mixture and place in the prepared baking dish.
Cover the dish with foil and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
author: Lena Garcia

name: Easy Tomato Soup
steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, celery, and garlic and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
Add the chicken or vegetable broth, crushed tomatoes, sugar, basil, oregano,salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 20-25 minutes.
Use an immersion blender or transfer to a blender and puree until smooth.
Return the soup to the pot and stir in the heavy cream. Heat through and serve hot.
author: John Doe

name: Spicy Black Bean Soup
ingredients: 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed
Sour cream and chopped cilantro, for serving
steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and red bell pepper and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
Add the garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the black beans, salsa, chicken or vegetable broth, cumin, chili powder, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 15-20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender or transfer to a blender and puree until smooth.
Serve hot, topped with sour cream and chopped cilantro.
author: Sara Lee

name: Thai Peanut Noodles
steps: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, garlic, ginger, and red pepper flakes.
Toss the spaghetti with the peanut sauce and green onions.
Serve hot or chilled, topped with chopped roasted peanuts.
author: Lena Garcia

name: Baked Lemon Chicken
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice and zest, garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour the lemon mixture over them.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot with your favorite side dishes.
author: Bob Johnson

name: Creamy Tomato Basil Pasta
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
Add the diced tomatoes and their juice to the skillet. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Stir in the chopped basil and heavy cream. Heat through.
Toss the spaghetti with the tomato sauce and grated Parmesan cheese.
Serve hot, topped with additional chopped basil and Parmesan cheese if desired.
author: Jane Smith

name: Thai Red Curry with Tofu
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
Add the red curry paste to the skillet and stir to combine with the onion and garlic. Add the sliced bell peppers and cook for 5 minutes, or until the peppers are tender.
Pour the coconut milk into the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Add the cubed tofu, fish sauce (if using), and brown sugar to the skillet. Simmer for 10 minutes, or until the tofu is heated through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
Stir in the chopped cilantro and season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.
author: Sara Lee

name: Grilled Steak with Chimichurri Sauce
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: Preheat grill to high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, garlic, parsley, cilantro, oregano, red wine vinegar, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the steaks with the herb mixture and place on the hot grill.
Grill for 4-5 minutes per side, or until the steaks are cooked to your desired level of doneness.
Remove the steaks from the grill and let rest for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with additional herb mixture if desired.
author: Adam Jones

name: Garlic Butter Shrimp Scampi
ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the shrimp are pink and opaque.
Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot with crusty bread or over pasta.
author: Lena Garcia

name: Baked Macaroni and Cheese
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cook the macaroni according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and whisk to combine. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the mixture is lightly golden.
Gradually whisk in the milk and bring to a simmer. Cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the mixture has thickened.
Stir in the shredded cheddar cheese and shredded mozzarella cheese until melted and smooth.
Add the cooked macaroni to the cheese sauce and stir to combine.
Transfer the macaroni and cheese to a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the top is lightly golden and bubbly.
Serve hot and season with salt and black pepper to taste.
author: Bob Johnson

name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: In a large skillet or saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they release their moisture and are tender.
Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
Add the Arborio rice to the skillet and stir to coat in the mushroom mixture.

Add 1 cup of broth to the skillet and stir until the liquid has been absorbed. Continue adding the broth in 1 cup increments, stirring frequently, until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Stir in the Parmesan cheese, heavy cream, and butter until melted and smooth.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot and garnish with additional grated Parmesan cheese, if desired.
author: Sara Lee

name: Crispy Baked Chicken Thighs
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a shallow bowl, whisk together the flour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper.
Dredge the chicken thighs in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken thighs to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until browned.
Transfer the chicken thighs to a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F.
Serve hot and garnish with chopped fresh herbs, if desired.
author: Adam Jones

name: Thai Red Curry
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until browned.
Add the bell peppers, onion, and garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 3-5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.

Stir in the coconut milk, Thai red curry paste, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Bring the mixture to a boil and then reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.
author: Lena Garcia

name: Lemon Blueberry Cheesecake Bars
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
In a medium bowl, stir together the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter until well combined. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and sugar together until smooth. Add the eggs, vanilla extract, and lemon juice, and beat until well combined.
Pour the cream cheese mixture over the graham cracker crust. Drop spoonfuls of the blueberry preserves over the cream cheese mixture and swirl with a knife.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the edges are lightly browned and the center is set.
Allow to cool completely before cutting into bars and serving.
author: Bob Johnson

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz.) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: Cook the quinoa according to the package instructions.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, feta cheese, parsley, and mint.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
author: Jane Smith

name: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
ingredients: 2 lbs. beef stew meat, cut into bite-sized pieces
Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides.
Transfer the beef to a slow cooker. Add the onion, carrots, potatoes, and garlic to the slow cooker.
In a small bowl, whisk together the beef broth, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, flour, thyme, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Pour the mixture over the beef and vegetables in the slow cooker.
Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 8-10 hours or on high for 4-5 hours, or until the beef is tender and the vegetables are cooked through.
Serve hot with crusty bread or over mashed potatoes.
author: Adam Jonese

name: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
Add the eggs and vanilla extract and beat until well combined.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using).
Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy!
author: Adam Jonese

name: Creamy Tomato Soup
ingredients: 2 cans (28 oz. each) whole peeled tomatoes
steps: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and their juice, breaking them up with a spoon.
Stir in the vegetable broth and dried basil.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the tomatoes have broken down and the soup has thickened slightly.
Remove the soup from heat and use an immersion blender to puree until smooth.
Stir in the heavy cream and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!
author: Adam Jonese

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
Add the peanut butter, egg, and vanilla extract and beat until well combined.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the peanut butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy!
author: Adam Jonese

name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the fettuccine pasta and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until al dente.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add the chicken and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until cooked through.
Reduce the heat to low and add the heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through.
Add the cooked fettuccine to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve hot.
author: Adam Jonese

name: Greek Salad
steps: In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and bell pepper.
Add the olives and feta cheese and toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
author: John Doe

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
steps: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the bell peppers, zucchini, squash, and mushrooms and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, or until tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, cornstarch, and water.
Add the sauce to the wok or skillet and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce thickens and coats the vegetables.
Serve over cooked rice.
author: Samantha Brown

name: Vegetarian Lasagna
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook the lasagna noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the zucchini, yellow squash, and bell peppers and continue to cook for another 5 minutes, until the vegetables are slightly softened.
Stir in the marinara sauce, basil, oregano, salt, and black pepper and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low and let the sauce simmer for 10 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, spinach, and half of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Spread a thin layer of the marinara sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer 3 lasagna noodles on top of the sauce, then spread a third of the ricotta mixture over the noodles.
Repeat the layers of sauce, noodles, and ricotta mixture two more times.
Top with the remaining shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheeses.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Cool for 10 minutes before serving.
author: John Doe

name: Caprese Salad
steps: Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating between the two.
Scatter the basil leaves over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve immediately.
Enjoy!
author: Samantha Brown

name: Caprese Salad
steps: Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating between the two.
Scatter the basil leaves over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve immediately.
Enjoy!
author: Samantha Brown

name: Spicy Shrimp Tacos
ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
steps: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, combine chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and cayenne pepper.
In a large bowl, toss shrimp with olive oil, then add spice mixture and toss to coat.
Grill shrimp until pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Warm tortillas on the grill, then divide shrimp among tortillas.
Top each taco with cilantro, cotija cheese, and a squeeze of lime.
Serve and enjoy!
author: Jane Smith

name: Grilled Chicken Salad
steps: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, Dijon mustard, salt, and black pepper.
Place chicken breasts in a large resealable plastic bag, then pour in marinade.
Seal bag and shake to coat chicken.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 8 hours.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from marinade and grill until cooked through, about 5-6 minutes per side.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice into strips.
In a large bowl, toss mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, red onion, feta cheese, and basil.
Divide salad among four plates, then top each with sliced chicken.
Serve and enjoy!
author: Jane Smith

name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
steps: In a medium saucepan, heat the broth over low heat.
In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and mushrooms and cook until tender.
Add the rice and stir until coated with the onion and mushroom mixture.
Add the white wine and cook, stirring, until it has been absorbed by the rice.
Add a ladleful of the hot broth to the rice mixture and stir until it has been absorbed.
Continue adding broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring frequently and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next, until the rice is creamy and tender.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese, cream, and butter.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!
author: Jane Smith

name: Lemon Blueberry Cheesecake Bars
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
8 oz. cream cheese, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Line an 8-inch square baking dish with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on two sides.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, and salt.
Cut in the butter using a pastry blender or two knives until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until lightly golden.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and 3/4 cup granulated sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until well combined.
Stir in the blueberries, lemon juice, lemon zest, and 1/4 cup flour.
Pour the mixture over the crust.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until set.
Let cool completely in the pan on a wire rack.
Serve hot and enjoy!
author: John Doe

name: Greek Salad
steps: In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine, sliced onion, chopped cucumber, sliced bell pepper, and cherry tomatoes.
Add kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Drizzle dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Serve and enjoy!
author: Bob Johnson

name: Pasta with Tomato Sauce
steps: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes, salt, and black pepper.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes, until sauce has thickened.
Add chopped basil and stir to combine.
Serve sauce over cooked pasta.
author: Bob Johnson

name: Grilled Chicken Salad
steps: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the chicken with the marinade and grill for 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice thinly.
In a large bowl, toss together the mixed greens, red onion, feta cheese, sliced almonds, and dried cranberries.
Top the salad with the sliced chicken and drizzle with the balsamic vinaigrette.
Serve and enjoy!
author: Sara Lee

name: Spicy Black Bean Soup
ingredients: 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed
Sour cream and sliced avocado for serving
steps: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the cumin, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the broth, black beans, and diced tomatoes and bring to a simmer.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the soup is thick and flavorful.
Stir in the cilantro and lime juice.
Serve hot, topped with sour cream and sliced avocado if desired.
Enjoy!
author: Sara Lee

name: Roasted Vegetable Lasagna
steps: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes, salt, and black pepper.
Simmer for 15-20 minutes, until sauce has thickened.
Add chopped basil and stir to combine.
Serve sauce over cooked pasta.
author: Sara Lee

name: Grilled Lemon Chicken
steps: Combine the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper in a small bowl.
Place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Remove the chicken breasts from the marinade and discard the marinade.
Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes on each side, or until cooked through.
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.
Enjoy!
author: Sara Lee

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz.) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
steps: Combine the quinoa and water in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender.
Fluff the quinoa with a fork and transfer to a large bowl.
Add the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and black pepper and stir to combine.
Add the cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, chickpeas, feta cheese, parsley, and mint and stir to combine.
Serve at room temperature or chilled.
Enjoy!
author: Lena Garcia

name: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
Add the eggs and vanilla extract and beat until well combined.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using).
Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy!
author: Lena Garcia

name: Creamy Tomato Soup
ingredients: 2 cans (28 oz. each) whole peeled tomatoes
steps: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and their juice, breaking them up with a spoon.
Stir in the vegetable broth and dried basil.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the tomatoes have broken down and the soup has thickened slightly.
Remove the soup from heat and use an immersion blender to puree until smooth.
Stir in the heavy cream and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!
author: Lena Garcia

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
Add the peanut butter, egg, and vanilla extract and beat until well combined.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the peanut butter mixture and beat until just combined.
Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the fettuccine pasta and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until al dente.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add the chicken and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until cooked through.
Reduce the heat to low and add the heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through.
Add the cooked fettuccine to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve hot.
author: Jane Smith

name: Greek Salad
steps: In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and bell pepper.
Add the olives and feta cheese and toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
author: Jane Smith

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
steps: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the bell peppers, zucchini, squash, and mushrooms and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, or until tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, cornstarch, and water.
Add the sauce to the wok or skillet and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce thickens and coats the vegetables.
Serve over cooked rice.
author: Jane Smith

name: Vegetarian Lasagna
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook the lasagna noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the zucchini, yellow squash, and bell peppers and continue to cook for another 5 minutes, until the vegetables are slightly softened.
Stir in the marinara sauce, basil, oregano, salt, and black pepper and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low and let the sauce simmer for 10 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, spinach, and half of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Spread a thin layer of the marinara sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer 3 lasagna noodles on top of the sauce, then spread a third of the ricotta mixture over the noodles.
Repeat the layers of sauce, noodles, and ricotta mixture two more times.
Top with the remaining shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheeses.
author: Maria Garcia

name: Caprese Salad
steps: Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating between the two.
Scatter the basil leaves over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve immediately.
Enjoy!
author: Adam Jones

name: Caprese Salad
steps: Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating between the two.
Scatter the basil leaves over the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve immediately.
Enjoy!
author: Adam Jones

name: Spicy Shrimp Tacos
ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
steps: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, combine chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and cayenne pepper.
In a large bowl, toss shrimp with olive oil, then add spice mixture and toss to coat.
Grill shrimp until pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Warm tortillas on the grill, then divide shrimp among tortillas.
Top each taco with cilantro, cotija cheese, and a squeeze of lime.
Serve and enjoy!
author: Adam Jones

name: Pesto Pasta Salad
steps: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain and rinse with cold water.
In a large bowl, whisk together pesto, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Add cooked pasta, cherry tomatoes, Kalamata olives, and feta cheese to the bowl and toss to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
author: Adam Jones

name: Classic Pancakes
steps: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick griddle over medium-high heat. Pour 1/4 cup batter onto the griddle for each pancake.
Cook until the edges are dry and bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another minute or until cooked through.
author: John Doe

name: Easy Baked Chicken Breasts
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with foil and lightly grease with cooking spray.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, garlic powder, onion powder, dried basil, dried oregano, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Place the chicken breasts on the prepared baking sheet and brush both sides with the seasoned oil.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.
author: Jane Smith

name: Mediterranean Stuffed Peppers
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Line a baking dish with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, stir together quinoa, feta cheese, Kalamata olives, parsley, oregano, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Fill each bell pepper half with the quinoa mixture and place in the prepared baking dish.
Cover the dish with foil and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
author: Sara Lee

name: Easy Tomato Soup
steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, celery, and garlic and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
Add the chicken or vegetable broth, crushed tomatoes, sugar, basil, oregano,salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 20-25 minutes.
Use an immersion blender or transfer to a blender and puree until smooth.
Return the soup to the pot and stir in the heavy cream. Heat through and serve hot.
author: Lena Garcia

name: Spicy Black Bean Soup
ingredients: 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed
Sour cream and chopped cilantro, for serving
steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and red bell pepper and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
Add the garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the black beans, salsa, chicken or vegetable broth, cumin, chili powder, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a simmer and let cook for 15-20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender or transfer to a blender and puree until smooth.
Serve hot, topped with sour cream and chopped cilantro.
author: John Doe

name: Thai Peanut Noodles
steps: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, garlic, ginger, and red pepper flakes.
Toss the spaghetti with the peanut sauce and green onions.
Serve hot or chilled, topped with chopped roasted peanuts.
author: Jane Smith

name: Baked Lemon Chicken
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice and zest, garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour the lemon mixture over them.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot with your favorite side dishes.
author: Bob Johnson

name: Creamy Tomato Basil Pasta
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
Add the diced tomatoes and their juice to the skillet. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Stir in the chopped basil and heavy cream. Heat through.
Toss the spaghetti with the tomato sauce and grated Parmesan cheese.
Serve hot, topped with additional chopped basil and Parmesan cheese if desired.
author: Adam Jones

name: Thai Red Curry with Tofu
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
steps: In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
Add the red curry paste to the skillet and stir to combine with the onion and garlic. Add the sliced bell peppers and cook for 5 minutes, or until the peppers are tender.
Pour the coconut milk into the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Add the cubed tofu, fish sauce (if using), and brown sugar to the skillet. Simmer for 10 minutes, or until the tofu is heated through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
Stir in the chopped cilantro and season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.
author: Lena Garcia
